website_summaries.verdict: While it's missing an RF option, Logitech's Harmony One is one of the best--if not the best--universal remote we've ever tested.
pros: Sleek design, both in terms of cosmetics and ergonomics
sharp LCD that offers a touch-screen interface and touch-sensitive buttons for navigation of onscreen menus
Web programmable via Windows or Mac PCs
rechargeable lithium-ion battery and docking station

customer_reviews.title: The battery life is terrible on the one I bought on Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: Still can’t believe Logitech discontinued this remote, nothing else comes close in comparison. I absolutely LOVE this Harmony remote, this is my 4th one. Dog chewed up the first one, husband kneeled on the screen of the second one, and the third ones still working but there’s an elbow mark in the middle of the touch screen also courtesy of the hubby...bought this one as a back up and the screens great but the battery it came with holds a charge maybe for a couple days. My original (3rd one) keeps a charge for weeks at a time and I use my remote for everything.
customer_reviews.author: Meas27

customer_reviews.title: Best model Harmony makes!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace one exactly like it. We couldn’t find it in the stores because it’s been discontinued. I shouldn’t have been because it’s the best one ever made! We loved the first one so much! You can control every function of your TV, Cable Box, DVD, and Receiver/Sound System with this one remote! We tried several of the other Harmony products and they just did not compare! This one has lasted us almost 15 years so I did not mind the high price! I wish they would continue to make this model, it’s hard to improve on perfection!
customer_reviews.author: PBROOK83

customer_reviews.title: temperamental volume button
customer_reviews.text: Finally decided to go for a universal remote to avoid the need for multiple remotes. The volume control button needs a bit of force or right angle when pressing it so I thought of returning it, but this has good functionality and no equivalent new model, decided to keep it. The price was also likely a factor in deciding to keep it, I bought a used remote for 35bucks + tax :-) and the remote was in really good condition. Two months now and the remote is still working well.
customer_reviews.author: Anand

customer_reviews.title: Logitechs mistake
customer_reviews.text: I have the same unit that I bought 10 years ago, never had a problem only had to replace the battery after 9 years. I bought this for a different room and it works great. I cant understand why Logitech discontinued this model, it is very intuitive to program and to use and fairly priced.
customer_reviews.author: FraserWorks

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer!
customer_reviews.text: It was all I could do to convince my husband that a universal remote would be better than the 5 different ones we were using, but now we'll never go back. TV, streaming, DVD, Chromecast--we toggle back and forth from one to another with little effort. It will occasionally get out of sync if we forget to keep it pointed in the right direction long enough, but hit "help" and it will walk you through getting everything back in order. Set up your account on your PC with all your devices and then sync to the remote. New equipment or subscriptions are easily added or edited by going back into your account and then resyncing.
customer_reviews.author: Karen B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Thanks for having this available
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! Thanks for having this available! They no longer make this model and the screen went out on ours. We have two in the house so I pirated the other one until this one arrived. I connected it and entered the devices with my software and it works first time!
customer_reviews.author: Tony R. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: HI-TECH AT ITS BEST!
customer_reviews.text: I've had two Harmony Remotes in two different homes and was pretty satisfied with their performance. A few months ago I acquired a new Sony AV Receiver and a new Sony Blu-Ray DVD player whose inputs and speed needed something meatier than the 550 model I'd been using for several years. So I shopped online and read other reviews of the Harmony One, and--based on all the positives--I ordered mine several weeks ago. It was very easy to program, and I love the features: A self-charging battery with its own "dock," the touch-command screen, and the comfortable ergonomic fit in your hand when maneuvering through your entertainment choices. The amazon.com price was right, and delivery was fast and efficient.
customer_reviews.author: bonnie brooklyn girl

customer_reviews.title: Great Remote
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this remote to anyone who needs to eliminate remote clutter and has very basic computer skills (required to connect the remote to program it). One word of advice, before you start to program your remote have all the EXACT make and model information of ALL your devices you plan to control with your remote ready. It will make things so much easier. My remote is controlling my LCD TV, Sony PS3 (needs an adapter for the PS3 to receive the signal), AV receiver, and wireless dimmer switch. My only complain about this remote is I wish you were able to control the size and location of the touch screen buttons. Other than that, it's a great remote!
customer_reviews.author: CoquiLostInNY

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Remote
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this used Harmony One remote to replace the one chewed on by the dog. I received the remote in the original box with all supporting equipment, but not knowing how to program it. I logged on to Logitech and sent them a message explaining that the installer had programmed the original remote. Two days later, I received guidance and an offer of further help. It took me about 30 minutes to download the software and program the remote. I have moderate technical capabilities. Other than the time it took to download the program and to look up the model numbers of the devices I sought to control, the actual programming took less than 10 minutes. Very cool.
customer_reviews.author: S. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Harmony One Universal Remote with Color
customer_reviews.text: This has been by far one of the best investments that I have ever made on a technological device. This remote does everything as advertised and more and not only that, it walks you through the steps no matter if you are not good with new technology (of which I am not). I haven't even jumped on the so-called smart phone train. I love this remote If logitech has wireless headphones for a price that I can afford (so I don't keep my spouse awake at night when I can't sleep) I would love to know how to get them. Excellent remote and you will never need another one!
customer_reviews.author: donnamarie

customer_reviews.title: Not the 900, but works ok
customer_reviews.text: Not the Harmony 900 (no longer available) but an ok alternative. No color buttons or configurable buttons, but still works ok. Logitech you had a winner with the 900, I’ve tried several of your products (Harmony One) and none compare to the 900. Bring it back!!!
customer_reviews.author: Matt Berntsen

customer_reviews.title: Returned It - Difficult To Navigate
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking to be able to control all of my setup with a single remote. I tried a previous Harmony remote, but didn't like it and returned it. A few years later, I gave the Harmony One a try and came to the same conclusion. The setup is very easy. The walk you through a wizard where you select all of your equipment. But in the end I was left with a remote, that while it could control all my components, I just found too difficult to navigate. I was used to simple with my TiVo remote. In the end, I ended up purchasing the TiVo Glo remote which has a few additional programmable buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Cory G.

customer_reviews.title: 6+ years and still going strong!
customer_reviews.text: I bought my Harmony One right here from Amazon in June 2010, so its over 6 years old now and after years and years of moderate to heavy use it still works great! But because of its age I have looked around at my replacement options and I do not know what I will do if it dies! I can only hope that Logitech will someday make the Harmony One again or at least something very similar to it because I love my Harmony One! Oh and it was only ~$147.00 + tax when it was new. :-)
customer_reviews.author: JWJ

customer_reviews.title: Still the benchmark in a universal remote control,
customer_reviews.text: This is our third copy of this particular model which now is sadly discontinued and only available as used or refurbished. It's sad that they discontinued this, because this unit is still the benchmark in my judgment in a universal remote control, given its enormous flexibility of configuration, the touchscreen, and the overall control layout. It's one omission is that it will not control PS3s which do not use infrared commands (? PS4s also). At the list price of $300 this universal remote control is not a great bargain, but used at half that, it's still the best integrated remote anyone has ever made.
customer_reviews.author: D. F. WattTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Product
customer_reviews.text: The product got 4 stars instead of 3 as it satisfies my expectations. The looks is great and my wife is happy in that she only has one control and that one control is easy to operate. Don't believe the "easy to program" instructions. I'm not a novice; however, it took me awhile to figure out the ins and outs of programming it. This product gets an "F" on easy to follow instructions. The price at $150 is not inexpensive. You will also have to spend a few dollars printing out the operating manual as it only comes in a pdf file. In any case, I feel the Harmony One is still good value.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty

customer_reviews.title: Harmony One
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with the Harmony One's online software and the fact they had all of my older equipment listed. My only caution is to users who do not know their equipment setup - connections and remote commands - this will make using the Harmony One a difficult process. My minor complaints are the touch screen is a little too touchy (even with reduced sensativity), and I don't like the scroll arrows and device selection soft-keys so close to the touch screen. I makes them too easy to accidentally hit when trying to select from the list of applications. For those who know their equipment and are technically adept, you will really appreciate the capabilities of this remote.
customer_reviews.author: Cully

customer_reviews.title: Decent Remote, but Fragile
customer_reviews.text: We bought this remote to replace a Harmony 650, which began to regularly fail because the batteries wouldn't seat properly. The rechargeable battery pack in this remote doesn't have the same problem, which is a plus. Other than that, the functionality is basically the same as the 650, with the touchscreen replacing some of the physical buttons on that remote. However, I have already cracked the LCD touchscreen in this remote by dropping it onto our living room floor. This type of fall hasn't caused a problem for other electronics (phones, tablets), but it rendered the top half of the remote's touchscreen illegible. However, despite the broken display, the touchscreen still responds well, and functions as intended.
customer_reviews.author: Damon K Roth

customer_reviews.title: Never buying Logitech again
customer_reviews.text: Although the hardware was perfectly usable, the software for this device was absolutely terrible. I'm using the past tense here because the remote recently stopped working. Since this model is now discontinued, Logitech tells me there's no way to repair it; it's also out of warranty so they won't replace it either. I now have a very expensive brick sitting on my coffee table, and you can be certain I'll never buy another Logitech product - "fool me once, shame on you; fool me twice, shame on me."
customer_reviews.author: Captain Nemo

customer_reviews.title: This company is run by morons for discontinuing this remote
customer_reviews.text: I love my remote. Since they stopped making them I bought this as a back up. Worth every penny. Battery lasted On one charge for a week for the first year then as it got older it would go down a little faster. It took it about four or five years before it got down to a day.
customer_reviews.author: Rattboy

customer_reviews.title: Takes some time to get used to.
customer_reviews.text: First, there's the gathering of model numbers, then inputting them and finding them on the Logitech software, then the updating of the remote (which takes quite some time)... The part that is most aggravating is the time it takes to upload to the remote. It takes 3-4 minutes, even if you only change one button command, the software uploads the whole list of commands. I think there are still a few buttons missing like access to my DVR using one of the real buttons (not the soft-screen buttons). Overall, it's a fingerprint magnet and it's slippery since the buttons are hard plastic, not rubber like the "lower" model ones.
customer_reviews.author: Gbcue

customer_reviews.title: Too much work to keep current
customer_reviews.text: I now have multiple Harmony's and while they sort of do what they are supposed to, the problem I have with the units is that they need to be updated via connections with your computer. That in itself is a pain as the only computer I have by my bed is my I pad and that is useless so I have to get a portable with a USB connection to connect to and then open the system, reprogram, test it for functionality, etc...etc...etc... pain in the tail. When someone comes up with wireless changes they will put harmony out of business.
customer_reviews.author: NC Mountainman

customer_reviews.title: The Most Amazing Remote - EVER!
customer_reviews.text: Why would a company discontinue a product that is so amazing that people are buying used ones for $399.00? Every now and again a product comes along that is so mind blowingly cool that it is irreplaceable. This remote is it. Very sad to see it go.
customer_reviews.author: Earendil

customer_reviews.title: looks nice, easy to use, when it works...
customer_reviews.text: The remote frequently doesn't register keypresses on the touch screen, the haptic feedback vibrates the remote but it doesn't actually register the command or send the IR signals. have to press it several times sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: MaDdIoS

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: Finally a remote that really works! We tried a Harmony 3 or 4 years ago and it totally frustrated us. Even the helpful tech people couldn't get it to synch our components. This time around I ran the software - which in spite of the message that it was not compatible with Win 7 worked. I wanted to add an old CD multi disc player and my iPod dock. Called the tech line and amazingly a very helpful lady in the Phillipines found all the serial numbers for me. It even controls all the Music Scenes on my Yamaha Amp. Excellent and most importantly my wife loves it and finds it easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: R. Barr

customer_reviews.title: Works wonderfully.
customer_reviews.text: After using this remote for a few weeks, I can say that I am satisfied with it. In past, Ive own remotes from Pronto, All in one and even previous Logitech remotes. The harmony one functions significantly better than the ones previously owned. With the pronto remote, you have to hunt down and program the macro codes for devices, however the Harmony One setup process is simple and straight forward. The remote does take a few times of programming to perfect every single function, however this process is simple and intuitive. The fit and feel of the remote is spectacular. I highly recommend this unit to people that need an all in one remote for their system.
customer_reviews.author: Islandson

customer_reviews.title: An expensive but thorough way to replace all of those remotes
customer_reviews.text: Initial set up was easy, with all basic functions quickly operational. I spent several hours however fine tuning things like the smart hub on our Samsung 7000. I bought the PS3 adaptor at the same time so I could avoid the frustration of not having a complete solution. I hated having to buy that thing as it was an expense that brought this purchase close to $180. I can't give it a 5 star rating because of all of the fine tuning. I won't give it a 3 star just because of price. The thing does what it does very well. It even handles my AppleTV.
customer_reviews.author: C. Riess

customer_reviews.title: Harmony One = Win
customer_reviews.text: One great remote. Period. Some of logitech stuff can be... questionable as far as quality goes. Ive had thier keyboards, cams, flight control equipment etc. But this remote. Fabulous. Cant say to how it will stand up over time, but its one great remote. The tablet remotes are nice, but having buttons is far better considering having to control a direcTV DVR and other equipment. The LCD screen is great and is quite sensitive to touch. Setup took me about 10 minutes and it worked flawlessly with my plasma TV, Sony DVD, Sony Reciever and DirecTV HD DVR. Going to get a second one for the bedroom. You cant go wrong with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Parks

customer_reviews.title: Offshore Tech Support is Useless, Not Good for Apple TV
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this but setting it up is challenging even for a technology worker. It doesn't play well with Apple TV (ie you still need to use the Apple remote) and the tipping point for me was trying to use their email and phone "Free 90-Day Tech Support". The phone goes to some joke of an offshore (Indian?) support center with lousy language skills. The email response I received was useless. It's going back tomorrow morning for a refund. I'll just rubberband all four of my remotes together, it'll work better than monkeying with this nerdtoy.
customer_reviews.author: F. Petronio

customer_reviews.title: Good Not Great
customer_reviews.text: This remote was easy to setup and program. All in all it works flawlessly. My wife doesn't care for it because she doesn't like having to use two hands for the remote, but that is just part of it with a touchscreen (which I prefer). If does seem like the battery life is pretty bad, but as long as you store it on the base charger, that isn't an issue. I control a Roku, Western Digital Streamer, Denon Receiver and Directv receiver with it. I think the interface is amazing and rarely have to reach for the original OEM remotes.
customer_reviews.author: JZ

customer_reviews.title: Control the whole entertainment center
customer_reviews.text: What is not to like? Easy to program, controls everything, and has its own charging cradle. A must have, and out of the multiple harmony remotes, this one was my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Lunchbox

customer_reviews.title: Awesome remote.
customer_reviews.text: So I've been looking to buy a universal remote for a long time and I finally decided to buy the Harmony One based on the good reviews. Gotta say, I can't remember what it's like NOT having a universal remote after only owning the One for a week now. The computer software used to set up the remote is really simple. They make it very easy to understand. Got the remote set up to work with all my entertainment devices. It's awesome only having to operate a single remote. The only real con as some reviewers have mentioned is the battery life but I think the usefulness of the One outweighs the con overall.
customer_reviews.author: ness180

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Harmony remotes for a decade. I still have two harmony 680s. I have a Harmony 720. This one does well. It fits nicely in the hands and looks nice. It's programming is typical harmony, so if you are used to Harmony remotes there are no real suprises there. Controls all my equipment with ease as expected. Has a good and powerful IR emitter as all my Harmony have had. Getting the touch screen sensitivity to my satisfaction has been a little challenging to both prevent accidental presses and be responsive when I want it. Overall I'm happy with it. Happy enough that I now have 2 of these.
customer_reviews.author: newlinux

customer_reviews.title: Superbe Remote
customer_reviews.text: We love this remote...pity they no longer make it. This is the first remote, including other Logitec ones, that truly replaces the half dozen remote controllers in our home theatre. We go ours used for less than other used ones and a fraction of the price of a new one.
customer_reviews.author: MauriceTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: If you have several components in you home theater system, this unit is worth the money to be rid of fumbling with multiple remotes... I have six components: TV, Cable Box, Surround Receiver, Blu-ray Player, DVR, and an A/V Switcher...eliminated all six remote controls and now use just the Harmony One....Love it!! You do the programming on your computer, and then download it to the Harmony One. I had to go through several iterations before I got it right, but it really was easy to follow the prompts... I think a few iterations are normal because there is a short "learning curve", and a little "trial and error" involved... highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Ritucci

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have used a number of universal remotes, including the Harmony 880. This is a huge improvement over the 880 mainly because the button quality is so much better and the recharging contact is an exact fit now. As with all Harmonys, the set up is very easy and can be programmed by anyone. The step by step setup guides you through the whole process. Along the same lines as the button quality, the ergonomics are great on the remote. The only mark against the remote is the touchscreen. It gets fingerprints very easily and just makes the remote look a little cheap. But that is a very minor gripe but enough to prevent a perfect rating.
customer_reviews.author: Drawring Simon

customer_reviews.title: It's so convenient!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second unit. I have one for my living room TV and now one for the bedroom. It is pretty easy to program and does a great job of replacing the tons of remotes I have collected. One note about the software. Why do they make you pick a user ID???? I wish that you could just plug it into the computer and it reads the current settings and allows you to edit from there. Why attach the settings to a user ID especially since I have 2 remotes that I now need 2 user IDs for!!
customer_reviews.author: Brian C

customer_reviews.title: You just don't get any better than this...
customer_reviews.text: If you have parents, or a loved one who gets befuddled with the multiple remotes we all seem to have today, this is the answer. They are really easy to set up and makes life for those less tech savvy much better. I have done several for friends and neighbors. You install software on your computer (mac or PC) and you create an account, log on, enter the model numbers of all your equipment and then it walks you through setting up "activities" which are like "turn on TV, Watch a DVD", and so on. Nice looking remote and very bright and clear screen.
customer_reviews.author: John V. Winn

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Remote!
customer_reviews.text: I had the 880 Pro before this one. Had it for several years and loved it. First universal remote that could clear the coffee table completely. However, I took it apart multiple times to fix the charging connections and the volume buttons. They always seemed to give me trouble. My buddy had the same problem with his 900 series model. This remote seems to have addressed those issues completely and I love the touchscreen buttons. Best Logitech remote yet! Good work on this one. Oh, the seller was fast and I would gladly do business with them again.
customer_reviews.author: A.J. Greenblatt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent remote
customer_reviews.text: I have three. They are easy to program. There are so many codes in Logitech's database that I have yet to come across a component that's not listed. It works well with an occasional blip that doesn't turn a component on or off when you tell it to. But when that happens, the fix is easy though with the intuitive "Help" option. The only real drawback I see to this remote is that I have big hands so holding the remote with one hand and accessing the buttons is not all that difficult. But I see that my wife has to use two hands to operate it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomasj106

customer_reviews.title: Made our TV watching experience much more enjoyable
customer_reviews.text: We had another universal remote to manage the six components (TV, soundbar, cable box, DVD player, Roku, switcher) in our entertainment system. It was very difficult to use causing major frustration. Once we switched to this one our lives were much easier. Now guests can actually use the TV. There are a couple of minor things that I could probably fix by spending more time programming but not worth it from my perspective. The beauty is programming it from the computer. You don't have to set tons of cryptic commands to get it going.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: 3rd Harmony One
customer_reviews.text: I love these remotes and I have yet to have one let me down. This will be my 3rd Harmony One, with the last 2 as gifts. I purchased my original one almost 3 years ago and it is still going strong. I gave one to my electronics inept dad who is 76 years old and he loves it. No more trying to figure out what buttons to push on what remote to just watch a DVD. The third was a gift to my wifes aunt and uncle who love it as well. Haven't really looked at the newer Logitech remotes because this one does everything I think a person would need so why pay for a newer one?
customer_reviews.author: mcavs

customer_reviews.title: Genius Design and Execution...
customer_reviews.text: If you want an easy to use, scaleable remote that does everything at a touch of one button...buy this remote. Regular firmware updates keep this remote up-to-date. It is very easy to program by hooking it up to your PC via an USB cable. Just specify what components you own, and it downloads all the codes and frequencies. You then assemble the components into "Activities" on your PC and download it to the remote. It is incredibly easy and the quality is excellent. You can also pull down customized channel icons to build your own graphic "Favorites" screen. There is no better remote at any price.
customer_reviews.author: Hurricane

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Harmony One Advanced Universal Remote
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Remote works flawlessly with my HDTV, receiver, set top Box, & Blu Ray DVD system. Solid construction. Buttons have a quality feel. Fast transmission of commands, especially compared with my old 880. Charging station takes minimal space and works well with the remote. Display is clear and touch screen works well - gestures work better than I expected. Setup through the PC-based application is much more convenient and less confusing that the older one I used with my Harmony 880. Editing channels and other setup data from the PC or remote is easy is easy, but...see below.
customer_reviews.author: C. L. Horton

customer_reviews.title: Making home theater safe for your parents.
customer_reviews.text: Without a doubt one of the most important products if you have a multi-system home theater and friends (or family) that are terrified by more than 1 remote. Harmony software and hardware make it super easy to reduce operating a complex home theater system to a few button pushes on a single remote. The color screen is intuitive and makes switching between activities very easy. Buttons are logically arranged and the charging cradle makes battery changes a thing of the past. First unit arrived DOA, but was quickly replaced by Amazon and have not had a problem since.
customer_reviews.author: Carpe_Diem

customer_reviews.title: A remote with class
customer_reviews.text: The refinements in this version are what convinced me to upgrade from the Logitech 659. After 2 months of use, I don't have any regrets in this purchase. It's a higher cost remote, but it seems so far to be a proven and reliable product which is why I chose it. The only criticism is a relatively narrow IR beam width (approximately 90 degrees horizontal and approximately 60 degrees vertical) which requires a little more aiming than the 659 it replaced. The Logitech Harmony software makes customizing this remote pretty easy. Not having to change AAA batteries every 4 - 6 weeks very helpful too.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ferrer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: This single remote controls my tv, receiver w/ surround sound, directv box w/ dvr and PS3 for watching movies. It performs as advertised and has a very strong signal. Based on other amazon reviews I purchased this remote instead of the newer design. Update: I've had this remote for several months now and it still works great. I am still very happy with my purchase. I recognize it is a fragile electronic device so I am very careful not to drop it. I've noticed several other reviewers complaining that they broke theirs. I constantly caution my wife about setting it on the edge of the coffee table etc. One drop is probably all it would take.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves it!
customer_reviews.text: We used to have five remotes and it would take a lot of memory to know which buttons to push when we wanted to watch TV or DVD or play music, etc. Now after simple programming of each piece of our home theater, we just push an 'activity' that we want like watching TV and all the components with their specific settings are turned on and ready to go. This is a lot more convenient, easy to use and we don't have to keep track of so many remotes anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Briamy

customer_reviews.title: Great remote - solves remote problems for good
customer_reviews.text: We had just moved, purchased a new Onkyo receiver. Could not get the Onkyo remote to operate the DirecTV box and all the features. I asked the Home Theater installer's opinion and he said - Buy a Harmony One. Well, I did and now it runs everything and does it very well. The answer to all remote problems. The programming of the remote went well, had to redo some of the programming for the satellite receiver but now, the Harmony One remote runs it all. The touch screen is great, the Activities button is great. Very satisfied. If you have a remote problem, get one now.
customer_reviews.author: Joe R. Mayo

customer_reviews.title: Very Impress With This Remote
customer_reviews.text: This is very os am Remote I only used it for about five days but its work so good and easy for any one to setup and use. only problem i got is On Windows 7 Software get Freeze some time and you have to restart but Remote Work Just Fine. i have Samsung tv and Sony DVD Player and Dish Box its work just fine with all device and i also setup some my favorite channel on this its so easy for my wife see loved this remote. even my daughter love this remote now i have one remote instead of five remote. i will add review after like month of use later.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Best Universal remote
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Harmony One. My wife loved the first one so much that we had to have this one for the other TV. It replaces all the remotes! I did give the setup 4 stars, because it took me a bit to get in sync with the setup menus (I wanted to do it my way ;-). It is really great not having to mess with learning codes during setup, as you have to with basic universals. This one is done all on-line, and they had all of our makes and models, including the A/V receiver, the X-Box, the Dish Satelite and the TV. Impressive. I would highly recommend this unit. Ignore the cost, and treat yourself.
customer_reviews.author: D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Remote
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good remote. Upgraded from the Harmony 800 after some of the buttons stopped working. I'm very happy with the buttons, the ability to customize, and the overall ease of use. Only complaints are 1. harmony setup program is a little bit annoying, but gets the job done, and 2. the angle of the IR beam from the remote points downward, which means I need to point the remote upward quite a bit to make it work (although this could just be the way the remote interacts with my IR repeater). Overall, I'm very happy with the remote, and glad I spent the money to upgrade from the older Harmony.
customer_reviews.author: Thompson C. Ritchie

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and it works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to simplify my A/V system for my spouse as well as ridding the coffee table of 5 separate remotes. I'm pleased to say that it does both. I use it to control my cable box, receiver, bluray player, and subwoofer. To complicate things a little I also use it to play my outside speakers from the same receiver. I've used many features of the remote including button customization, IR learning, and channel lableling. I'm happy to say it has been a breeze so far and I'm amazed at the level of flexibility. I would recommend this remote for anyone who loves customization and tweaking their A/V system.
customer_reviews.author: Whitt P

customer_reviews.title: Been a harmony user from the begining
customer_reviews.text: This is my third harmony remote and my first one since Harmony was bought buy Logitech. Harmony support has slipped a bit, but the product is still unparalleled in the industry. My wife fought me and fought me on why we should spend so much on a remote. She also fought me about DVD's, Blue-rays, and DVR/Tivo. Each time I was right and each time i threatened to take it away she would mock Charlton Heston " pry it from my cold dead fingers". It's worth it, it makes your entertainment system easy and simple. My 4 year old understands how to use it flawlessly (limited tv time of course)
customer_reviews.author: Scuba J

customer_reviews.title: A universal remote that really is
customer_reviews.text: Very solid unit that works as advertised. (I have another one just like it in a different room.) My only complaint is that I'd like finer grained control over the timing as it turns on my devices. I can set the order but the only time adjustment is to prevent sending IR codes too soon. I have a complex AV system with an HDMI extender between a receiver and the TV. If the devices turn on too quickly the HDMI connection fails to negotiate. I worked around the problem but the result is a little hacky. But overall I'm very pleased with the remote.
customer_reviews.author: Amazoner Stallion

customer_reviews.title: Nice remote.
customer_reviews.text: Love the remote. Very versatile and mostly easy to set up. They updated the set-up software and I was unable to transfer some of the "special buttons" I programmed with the old software. So to make changes I have to pull out my old computer that has the old software installed. This is a pain, but quicker than trying to figure out all over what I did to get things to work right.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Funny story... I was looking for the 980 and ordered the One accidentally - don't ask. Anyway once I received the product I played with the idea of returning. Then after a little consideration I decided to at least try it in my new family room, which is smaller than the last - so really I don't need the RF goodness of the 980. I Like: - The touch screen. - The charging cradle. - The feel of the remote in your hand. Don't Like: - Unable to change activity icons. - Slow to update after making changes - don't do this much anyway. Overall it's a great remote and I'm happy with my accidental purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT HODDER

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this remote for one year. It is a great product. Syncd with all of my old and new gear in the cabinet and with an IR flasher, allows me to close the door on the cabinet. I love being able to customize features, such as controlling my room lighting with my Lutron dimmers. It works from at least 50 feet away which is nice if I am in the kitchen cooking. Only minor issue is that after lots of use, part of the rubber backing is coming off the rear of the unit which is too bad, but not a huge issue. Get one of these, you will be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Barker

customer_reviews.title: Great design and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The software setup was very simple. Once I input all devices, it asks simple questions to control each device - nothing more than what I need to know to set it up manually. The only problem was setting up my Roku streaming device; it's not listed correctly so it took a little research to find that it is under DVD players instead of media devices. If there is a problem starting an 'Activity'(getting your TV to the correct input setting), a single click on the 'Help' button will usually fix it right away. If it does not, it will ask simple 'yes' and 'no' questions to determine the issue and fix.
customer_reviews.author: Cosmic

customer_reviews.title: Remote works well
customer_reviews.text: I like the remote as it works well although I cannot get it set up correctly to operate my Denon 4310 for zone 2 and 3. I have not had the chance to call support yet and will soon. From what I understand you have to create another device for additional zones so you can have all the functions of the device. Otherwise it does what is advertised and was easy to set up using the software although at times it does get confused. For example if I in one activity and go to another it may turn off a device when it is still needed. The help button works rather well making corrections when this happens.
customer_reviews.author: Jason A. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Software is a slow nightmare
customer_reviews.text: The remote works great once it is programmmed, however the way it works is once the software finally pops up to where you can begin entering information it is extremely slow. IT has to save you information to logictech's sever then finally, you hit "program remote". The information has to come back from their server to your remote. This works sometimes, most times you sit there wiht nothing happening until the server times out, then back to square one. Based on this I would not recommend this remote.
customer_reviews.author: young

customer_reviews.title: Great remote!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a Harmony remote for 7+ years now and I love them. I purchased this remote to replace my Harmony H659 remote that finally died which I have had for several years. This remote has a lot of great customized features which gives you complete control on how you want your devices to operate. So far I have no complaints or negative things to say about this remote. I would advise to handle it with care, based off all the other negative reviews i'v read some people are too hard on these high end remotes. Overall I am extremely satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Harmony One
customer_reviews.text: Was very easy to program (and re-program as I changed my mind). Covered every device I had and the radio link works well with equipment a couple of rooms away. Works consistently well; has an occasional hiccup, but the "Help" function fixes those instantly. Strongly suggest that you get to know and understand how it works and, after using it a while, modifying your setup by adding and changing the functions of the buttons and the virtual buttons. Works better than a much more expensive universal I have.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Krischer

customer_reviews.title: My favorite universal remote
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite of all the universal remotes. Easy to setup and use. I had a battery go bad but Logitech is very easy to deal with and they replaced it with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Marcheschi

customer_reviews.title: Works great if you program it properly
customer_reviews.text: I have used this most every day for over 3 years with no problems. I did have someone who knows what they are doing program it and that probably helps a lot. It operates my TV, Skylight and room lights with no problems. One thing you should know is that you must continue to point this at the receiver for about 10 seconds to make sure all the items come on and go thru the complete cycle.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Remote
customer_reviews.text: Bought this remote for my dad for Christmas. He had recently purchased a new Sony 3D and 3D Blu ray player. It works well with both of the Sony devices, the cable box, and our stero system. He likes how you are able to program your favorite channels and have easy access to Netflix via the remote. It stays charged for days and the display is easy to read. The programming of the remote is a little time consuming and you need to download the program on a computer. Overall, a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: rs0220

customer_reviews.title: Everything about this remote is great
customer_reviews.text: Best remote I ever had. Once the setup was complete it was so easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Love this Product - Not so Much Anymore
customer_reviews.text: Got this a couple of years ago, and it's still going strong. Have added and removed several devices with ease. When this one finally goes, I will definitely get another one. Right after I posted this, the remote died. Got a new battery, but now get nothing but a white screen. Tried firmware update, but it didn't work. Checked the web, but it seems that if the firmware doesn't work, there's nothing left to do but chuck it. As expensive as it is, it should last more that 2.5 years.
customer_reviews.author: Linda H.

customer_reviews.title: It works!  And it troubleshoots itself.
customer_reviews.text: Even a technophobe can use this to navigate a complex AV system. Although they may need a little help with the setup.
customer_reviews.author: DIYArchitect

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Harmony universal remote so I knew what I was getting into. Thisbis working perfectly. Our main Tv has a separate sound system and a cable box so the alternative is three remotes to turn everything on just to watch Tv and additional remotest to operate the Dvd and our netflix box. I really like how easy it is to pick the unit to be controlled by model number. When trying to program other remotest it always seems that there was one device they didn't have codes for. The logitech has a very complete listing the unit works flawlessly
customer_reviews.author: John Mills

customer_reviews.title: Works Very Well...Takes Some Getting Used To
customer_reviews.text: I really do like this product. Setup via the software was easy and painless. Accomplished that in 30 minutes. If this is the only remote you'll use it will work flawlessly. However, my wife still uses a different more primitive remote and I have noticed if she turns on the TV without me, I have to press the power switch on this remote (while NOT aiming it at the TV) in order to have it in sync with the TV operation. A minor annoyance but one I thought I'd mention. Appears to be a high quality device.
customer_reviews.author: amazonbuyer

customer_reviews.title: excellent remote but software/website can't handle multiple units from a single account
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. The only complaint I have is that the included software/website setup can't accommodate more than a single remote from the same account (this is lame and a serious oversight). I bought 2 remotes (one for my living room setup and one for my master bedroom setup) and I needed to create 2 separate accounts to have these remotes programed instead of just having the ability to add additional units in one account. Did somebody in Logitech not think that allowing purchasers the ability to buy multiple units and use a single account would be a good idea?!?
customer_reviews.author: A. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Smart but...
customer_reviews.text: One of the coolest programmable remotes. Well done and has a pretty look. The only issue is a software. Yes, you can configure any action you want. But the known devices internet base is not complete enough. And the most frustrative thing is a program that you should use to configure the remote. The interface and usability of that program is ugly. Just imagine: to move the item of the list from the bottom to the top you should click different buttons tens of times. It is good that the configuration if this device should be done rarely.
customer_reviews.author: domovoi

customer_reviews.title: A great remote
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one of these. The first one was crushed under my son's careless behind, and I really could't live without it! Programming it is super simple using your computer, and it is so easy to use. One of the features I really like is the range. I have a pretty large room (32 feet) and this thing works not only across that room, but from the kitchen adjacent to it. That is a total of about 40 feet. Impressive. I love this remote.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Harmony One
customer_reviews.text: Set up is not difficult if you have all the information about your devices handy. The touch screen at times does not communicate well even after setup if your TV is already on which can be frustrating if you had your TV on with a different remote in the room. It does operate all my devices which is a plus, but the functions it supplies as default for these different devices are not all needed and prioritized funky. For example, the on off toggle for one device is on the second screen instead of the first screen with some other functions I don't use on the first screen.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Working as intended
customer_reviews.text: It does everything as advertised. Configuration for the most part was easy since I replaced an old non-working Logitech universal remote (the one marketed for use with the Xbox 360) which meant all my settings were stored online. The custom button(s)control/configuration is a huge plus for me. I now don't have to go through certain submenus and button presses; one button press and voila. This probably has consumed the most of my time (since the devices to be configured had already been entered and stored).
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: I finally have my end table back!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my techie husband. I was sick and tired of having 4 different remotes taking up the whole end table - as well as needing a PhD in computers to figure out how to do things with our TV/DVR/TIVO system with all those remotes! After a bit of a difficult set-up (my husband is a techie and even he struggled with it a bit), I've decided it was worth it! A small learning curve, but it's pretty intuitive and works well. The only thing we had to get used to is keeping it pointed at the system while it does its thing. But I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: MKL

customer_reviews.title: ... to a Universal Remote Control MX-900 MX900 Genesis ( Great paperweight ) which stopped working after several months of ...
customer_reviews.text: This Logitech Harmony was purchased as a replacement to a Universal Remote Control MX-900 MX900 Genesis ( Great paperweight ) which stopped working after several months of light use. The Logitech has performed well and is much more user friendly than the previous remote.This model is discontinued but I do recommend Logitech's remote control products because they seem to be engineered towards easy consumer use.
customer_reviews.author: C. P. Palatine

customer_reviews.title: Very Cool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my husband. We were thinking that it was going to be really hard to set up but the set up was very easy. We are using it for our DirectTV, DVD player, radio. The program had a the buttons already in its program for the directv box which was great. Not sure how the charge on the remote will be but it has a really nice docking station for it. Also all the button are in central locations making it a very easy product to us. Another great feature is that the product is not heavy as expected. It is very light. Great product so far.
customer_reviews.author: Teisha Combs

customer_reviews.title: Only one remote
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these. One for my son and one for us. It controls his PS and tv components. Ours does the direct tv, dvd, receiver and tv. That got rid of 4 remotes which I love. The only bad thing is ours got dropped on the hardwood one too many times and the screen went out. It still works though, but we just had to remember where to push the screen for the components....it's been that way for well over a year! Other than making this more durable we still love it.
customer_reviews.author: Tami D

customer_reviews.title: Buy - before it is gone.
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have remote for those who would prefer physical buttons on their remote over soft buttons. The configuration and set up is easier than before - however, there is a slight learning curve to understand the context of each button. Logitech's website makes it easier to set up - however, it now requires you to make an account to store your settings. My remote was refurbished and some buttons seem to have a funny click to them after a few weeks of use, keep in mind this might be expected, if you buy refurb.
customer_reviews.author: Aditya Prasad

customer_reviews.title: Great remote BUT bad LCD
customer_reviews.text: The remote worked great, managed 4 separate components flawlessly. However, after several months the display failed. I contacted Logitech and they said they did not warranty physical damage, although I do not recall any such trauma to the remote. Logitech offered me a replacement for 1/2 price and I took the deal. Well I am writing this review now that the repacement remote LCD had a similar failure. 2 for 2 of the same defect is not a good record. So this is a great product if you don't mind paying $100+ every several months for the privelege. I do not know what to get next now that I am invested in this technology with the PS3 add-on.
customer_reviews.author: davic

customer_reviews.title: Pleasant surprise
customer_reviews.text: It's difficult to think of something bad to say ... Easy, has almost everything I imagined it might have, feels nice and heavy - substantial (I didn't know it even mattered to me). Logitech is trying to do it right. Now I wish they'd make application specific hotkeys for their keyboards. The remote is well lit, seems to produce a stronger signal than my other remotes. You do have to be careful about where you touch on the screen and it has one of those flaky little rubber covers for the USB port. This is one of the best purchases I've made lately.
customer_reviews.author: Benn

customer_reviews.title: Great to have one remote!
customer_reviews.text: This device worked fine. However one of my devices was defaulted to "No sound through the HDMI output". With several calls to tech support they were able to isolate the issue. The manufacturer of the device gave me the info to turn on the audio through the HDMI output. The harmony works great and tech support was exceptional. Installation is easy IF you have all the correct information for all of the devices you are syncing written out ahead of time, this will save a lot of headaches. (model numbers, serial numbers etc.)
customer_reviews.author: barefoot1

customer_reviews.title: nice design - issues with set up and usability
customer_reviews.text: Pros:nice design, no issues with charging cradle (like last model). great battery life Cons: too reliant on "soft keys" compared to the last Logitech device I had - results in too many touches, online set up is tricky and I can't seem to make the remote function properly with my entertainment system, I double-checked the settings and it seems right but it has trouble sending the proper signals to my Vizio especially. Will call CS and update this review if they can help me.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gottlieb

customer_reviews.title: Harmony One
customer_reviews.text: Was a bit skeptical as to ease of use and unit's ability to replace all my remotes, but this product exceeded all my expectations. Very easy to set up, and easier to use. Replaced all six remotes for my home theater, including a Dish Network PVR, and everything works flawlessly. Buttons on Harmony One perform the same functions as same buttons on each individual remote, so no guesswork. I would definitely recommend the Harmony One to anyone tired of juggling multiple controls, and I'm very happy I spent the extra money this item cost. Well worth it in my opinion. Even my wife agrees that this was a good investment !!
customer_reviews.author: B. MacKinnon

customer_reviews.title: Sweet! Why didn't I get one sooner?
customer_reviews.text: My worries were correct in that I had error messages when downloading the program into a Windows 7 computer but I just went ahead and everything works fine. It also had a couple other error messages when I was programming it, but again I just kept going and it all works great. I should of got one of these years ago. It is so great. Battery life appears to not last very long though (could be because I never got a full charge before using). Overall very pleased and proud of myself. HAHA! Remote works with all my gadgets and is relatively easy to set up. It even works the Xbox 360, which is great.
customer_reviews.author: Buck

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This device replaced a 7 year old universal remote that we had programed by the folks who installed our system and never really worked the way we hoped. We had a few minor problems with Harmony One programming that were solved with a quick and pleasant phone call. Once we understood all the potential of the device and played with the programming, it was able to do everything we wanted. I feel like I can handle any changes I may need in the future. We have a fairly complex system with cable box, stereo receiver, VCR, DVD, 100 disk CD player. The one thing we don't have is a game console.
customer_reviews.author: Mike K

customer_reviews.title: No longer will work on new devices
customer_reviews.text: At the beginning this remote was fine. Now that we got a newer TV and amplifier it will no longer work. Doesn't recognize any of the new devices and the so-called service time has expired ... whatever that means. As much as I paid for this device it should have unlimited service time. Harmony wont even let me contact them to find out as to why this remote wont recognize our new devices. When I say new they are now over a year old ... so they aren't too new.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Good remote
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my hubby and overall we love it. The ONLY complaint is that somehow the XBox 360 setting got screwed up and no matter what my husband does to try to reset the darn thing, the cycle for on/off is screwed up. Like the TV and audio will come on but it shuts the XBox off. Or the XBox comes on but nothing else does. He's done the troubleshooting, has reset it, has deleted it and added it back but still can't get it fixed. Would totally buy it again though!
customer_reviews.author: HeatherB

customer_reviews.title: Awsome piece of device
customer_reviews.text: Recently bought this fancy little piece of electronic... after juggling with more or less 10 remotes. Watching TV or a movie was a tiresome task ... with the activities .. stiwch on TV, set to HDMI, reset HDMI switch blah blah. After harmony .. I could continue to be a couch potato .. and it does everything for me. All I need to make sure is .. the devices qre power on. I am loving every bit of this remote .. expecially the Activities featrure. Through some learning and programming it works more or less fine with everything.
customer_reviews.author: Neer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Universal Remote
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 Harmony 880 remotes and the worst issue I had with those was the charging base died for both of them. Found a quick workaround on that issue. That being said I still think Logitech makes a sleek universal remote. I have no problem with the Harmony One, setup was as easy as with the 880. Functionality is even better than the 880. Layout is more simple and the buttons are larger and better placed. If you are looking for a solid universal remote (non RF), the Harmony One is an excellent choice.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Freak

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the 880 !!!!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a perfectly good Harmony Remote #880 with this model and I am extremely satisfied with the Harmony One. Better ergonomic feel, much better lighting on the Activities, touch screen is really cool, battery compartment lid is not prone to breaking like the 880 was. I especially like Logitech's online registration and the ability to tweak Activities and the ease of adding a new Device. And the PRICE from Amazon is Amazing! I really like Amazon's new retail packaging. Thanks Amazon !!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tom in Oregon

customer_reviews.title: This is fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this more than a year ago and can't beleive we did not purchased this sooner. With a sound bar, PVR, TV, game console, Blu Ray, computer etc, you can program this thing easily to turn things on off etc. The help feature is also pretty good in that in the off chance that something does not work as intended (which is seldom) - you just press the help button and through a series of a yes / no responses, your system is working the way you programmed it in a matter of seconds. By the way, the online database of remotes is very extensive!
customer_reviews.author: YadaYada

customer_reviews.title: Lasts a long time
customer_reviews.text: My favorite part about this remote is it lasts a long time. I got tired of the cheap units the cable company provides, on which certain keys stop working after only a few months. I've had this for a couple years, and it still works perfectly. What I don't like, is it doesn't seem to do all the functions I need for my BluRay player, so I use this only for my cable system (ATT UVerse).
customer_reviews.author: D. J. Walters

customer_reviews.title: Harmony One remote
customer_reviews.text: Great packaging from Amazon. The device is easy to sync up with your PC and the set-up process is fairly intuitive if you are familiar with Windows based formats. The set-up, though, will only take 30 minutes as described in the directions if you have an extremely simple AV set up or none at all. If you have a number of components are looking for the remote's full functionality it will take you 1 - 1 1/2 hrs to set up properly, including logos for favorites, etc. At first glance it look like the hype is true, this looks like the remote to end all remotes.
customer_reviews.author: Guido Sarduchi

customer_reviews.title: Best Remote Ever
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely a "must have" if you despise multiple remotes. I'm always skeptical of marketing/product descriptions but this does everything it says it will. Nothing easier than entering your component brand/model and having it set up automatically. Picked up another for my girlfriend at the time and custom programmed it for managing her iPhone playlists through the Sony receiver. Its a little pricey but worth every penny if you can afford it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Osborn

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift
customer_reviews.text: There is NO better way for a guy to show the woman he loves how serious he is about her than to share the remote? Better yet, give her HER OWN remote. A high-tech, single remote that controls EVERYTHING. No matter how obsecure your equipment is, this single device can handle it! Have you seen that confused look on a loved one's face when they don't know which remote to use? Well, THIS PRODUCT will elimate that look forever. Show the person you love just how much and buy them one of these!
customer_reviews.author: Chris M

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Probably overkill for my needs, but it is great to put the other three remotes away for good. My wife can watch a movie now if I am not at home to set it up for her. Setting it up on the computer is a breeze and the help function on the remote has already helped her when she forgets to keep the remote pointed towards the entertainment center until all the settings have been transmitted. Pricy, but considering I will eventually have updated equipment and possibly more units to control, I am very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: TRULY A GREAT UNIVERSAL REMOTE
customer_reviews.text: This Harmony One remote, has pleasantly surprised me. After doing some research, I decided to see for myself if it was a product that could eliminate my four remotes. Not only did the Harmony One learn all of the them with ease, but it offers the ability to download your favorite icons so you don't have to enter the channel number. If you want to watch ESPN, you just tap the icon. You are limited however, to twenty-four of your favorites. Just download everything from your computer, and you are good to go. Again, a truly great universal remote that I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: E. Burns

customer_reviews.title: wondurful solution !!
customer_reviews.text: well its a nice solution for the people who requires to use many remot control the beutey of this remote that its updated and logitech data base is updated frequantly where you dont have to worry when you are getting in you shelf a new product its sure that you will have its program in the logitech data base and in rarly situation if u didn't find the codes for an product you can just use the learn option where you can make the harmony learns from the product remote
customer_reviews.author: kooji

product_meta.title: Logitech Harmony One Advanced Universal Remote (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
